title: Never-ending you are ineligible to earn loot due to previous behavioral restrictions.
body:
So, i've been chat restricted for 2 games i misbehaved, for a total of 10 games, which was fair.
But now, after the chat restriction ended, I still cannot obtain loot.

I've search a bit, and turns out you keep this 'punishment' for a bit longer, however, i've played like 10-15 games AFTER the restriction ended, and I still don't get rewards?

For how long does this bs last, because this is really really demotivating, since i've played-out my restricted punishment games already.

replies.body:
Not receiving hextech loot is not a punishment. Receiving hextech loot is a reward for sportsmanlike players. When you were punished, the reward was revoked as well, similar to how honor is reset when you are punished. The fact that your punishment is up does not mean your account is in good enough standing to receive hextech rewards.

> Your reform period isn't over after a specific number of games, or after a certain date, but is completely dependent upon your behavior.

Guys, can't you just call it a punishment instead of playing the semantics game. I went through it and got it taken care of and I'm back to receiving hextech rewards, and I definitely felt like it was a punishment.

I mean, you kind of say it yourself. You don't get this "reward" because you're not being good enough. If i'm not being good, it sounds like I deserve a punishment, so calling it a punishment sounds pretty appropriate. And, all in all, what is considered a punishment or not is really, or at least should really, be in the eyes of the one being punished. The chat restriction was hardly a punishment at all, given that I don't like to talk much in game anyway. But getting an S rank in the majority of the games I was playing to get my hextech rewards back and not being able to receive anything sucked soooooo hard.

What's the difference between saying "you can't type more than 5 messages," "you can't play this game for a week," and "you can't have hextech rewards" if it's all because of your bad behavior?

Just call it a punishment. I find it to be a pretty effective one. Mainly because it's pretty much the only way to get rewarded for being good at the game. Guess it really depends on how good someone is at playing though. Telling someone who can't win or get S ranks they can't have what they already can't get doesn't help much, lol.

The fact that he, while being punished, can go into the store and buy the very loot you claim he is denied from earning otherwise, is proof of the real motivations at play, if it doesn't outright explain the nebulous nature of the reform tier system. 

As to restrictions being a punishment:

https://www.google.com/#q=punishment

>the infliction or imposition of a penalty as retribution for an offense.

It 100% is. This is a penalty imposed upon earning a reward, that, by the very definition, of the very first thing that pops up when you google "punishment", is a punishment. Please retire this embarrassing defense. In the past, the language surrounding the loss of end of season ranked rewards was always that of punishment for behavioral reasons. Far too late to change the language now.

Sorry to bump an old topic but I just wanted to get another's input or a Rioters. It's said that the ineligibility to obtain loot after the restrictions ends is dependant on your personal behavior. Based on what I've read here that means going through games without a single valid report. However, what if you run into one of those games where you literally say nothing offensive in chat and play well but you are with or against a pre-made who is set on trolling everyone and reporting you for no reason. Does Riots system recognize that these reports should be invalid or does this affect your chances of getting the privilege of getting loot back?
I believe the time of you not getting rewards is based off of time, not games.

> [{quoted}](name=Shenpai Ekko,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Wjgpp3xY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-07-18T12:26:45.651+0000)
>
> I believe the time of you not getting rewards is based off of time, not games.

It is based on games and not time. The punishment scale is based on time, 3 months to fall off to the next level. But it takes around 40 games with zero valid reports. I went through ARAMs and got mine off in about 3 days at around 30 something games...

Granted now I'm getting extremely frustrated because I'm afraid to say something to the duo mid that's feeding the whole team, and still cant even ping MIA, lol.

You need to show consistent, improved behavior after your punishment is over in order to start earning loot again, although the more severe your punishment was, the longer this will take. Since your punishment was just a 10 game chat restriction, this could take only a few weeks (based on what I have seen reported by other players), however, if you aren't showing improved behavior, this could very well take much longer.

For more information about hextech restrictions, you can read this guide: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209939463-Hextech-Crafting-Restrictions

It take roughly 3 months for a player to prove reform to the system or to drop a tier level of toxicity. Punishment is only there to punish you and warn you that you are on the track of perma ban. It has nothing to do with reform in its self.

You need to prove that you are reformed through a significant amount of time and effort (games played). Most players average 2 games a day 5 days a week (averaging casuals and hard core fans). Its going to take a large sample size/games played to reduce the 3 month thresh hold.
Hextech is for the good boys and girls.
